comments.raw_text:
Ran into this just by opening new windows after browsing for a few hours already.
The screenshot shows both the UI and some messages in the Error Console.

The browser.js error in the console is actually at http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/base/content/browser.js#1427 (because of includes)
and the add-on involved is Bugzilla Tweaks by Ehsan.
comments.creator: mars.martian+bugmail@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: Oh, uh, if I didn't make it clear, browser.js and and Jetpack are being bit by the same unexpected problem, gBrowser.browsers has at least one undefined element, but it's not clear what caused the problem.  Since gBrowser.browsers is involved, moving to Firefox::Tabbed Browser.

comments.author: mars.martian+bugmail@gmail.com
comments.text:
I searched through the gBrowsers and found a kind of weird case.
I attached a screenshot of the first tab in a window, the title is not set and the url-bar is empty except for the identity box. Furthermore, scrolling in the page does nothing (i.e. the content does not change) but if I switch tabs and then switch bar, the content has moved as though a scroll occurred.
Looking at that gBrowser.browsers though:
> gBrowser.browsers;
[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement]

while the first location does not make sense

> gBrowser.browsers[0].docShell.document.location;
about:blank

the second does

> gBrowser.browsers[1].docShell.document.location;
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=450952

Furthermore, the other tabs in that window behave normally along with the window.
comments.creator: mars.martian+bugmail@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
I searched through the gBrowsers and found a kind of weird case.
I attached a screenshot of the first tab in a window, the title is not set and the url-bar is empty except for the identity box. Furthermore, scrolling in the page does nothing (i.e. the content does not change) but if I switch tabs and then switch bar, the content has moved as though a scroll occurred.
Looking at that gBrowser.browsers though:
> gBrowser.browsers;
[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement],[object XULElement]

while the first location does not make sense

> gBrowser.browsers[0].docShell.document.location;
about:blank

the second does

> gBrowser.browsers[1].docShell.document.location;
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=450952

Furthermore, the other tabs in that window behave normally along with the window.
